title: Israeli Strikes Kill 5 in South Lebanon , Including 3 Children
message:
Lebanese official media reported that separate Israeli strikes on Tuesday in southern Lebanon resulted in the deaths of five people, including three Syrian children.
According to the National News Agency (NNA), three Syrian children were killed in an airstrike that targeted farmland in the village of Umm Toot.
The United Nations children’s agency, UNICEF, expressed concern over the ongoing violence, highlighting the tragic death of three children in southern Lebanon.
The Israeli military reported that 40 projectiles were fired from Lebanon on Tuesday, followed by an additional 10 later in the day.
The Israeli air force responded with strikes on Hezbollah sites in southern Lebanon, including a “terrorist cell” near Umm Toot.
event_breakdown: Israeli Strikes in Southern Lebanon Kill 5 People, Including 3 Syrian Children

title: Lebanon media says 3 children among 5 dead in Israeli strikes
message:
Smoke bilows following an Israeli strike in the village of Kfar Kila in southern Lebanon on July 16, 2024 (Rabih DAHER)Lebanese official media said separate Israeli strikes Tuesday in south Lebanon killed five people including three Syrian children, with Hezbollah announcing rocket fire at Israel in retaliation.
It also said an "enemy" drone strike had targeted a motorcycle on the Kfar Tebnit road elsewhere in south Lebanon, killing two Syrians.
Hezbollah said it launched rounds of "Katyusha rockets" at northern Israel in response to the Israeli strikes.
The Israeli military said 40 projectiles fired from Lebanon were initially identified Tuesday, followed by a further 10 later in the day.
The air force launched strikes against parts of south Lebanon where it said there were Hezbollah sites, including a "terrorist cell" in the Yarin area, which is close to Umm Toot.

title: Israeli strikes across Gaza kill at least 57 , Palestinian health officials say
message:
Israeli forces battled Hamas-led fighters in several parts of the Gaza Strip on Tuesday, and Palestinian health officials said at least 57 people were killed in Israeli bombardments of southern and central areas.
In Rafah, a southern border city where Israeli forces have been operating since May, five Palestinians were killed in an airstrike on a house, Gaza health officials said.
Later on Tuesday, an Israeli airstrike on a car killed at least 17 Palestinians and wounded 26 others in Khan Younis in southern Gaza, the officials said.
At least 38,713 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's retaliatory offensive since then, Gaza health authorities said in their latest update on Tuesday.
That attack killed more than 90 people in the Khan Younis area, according to Gaza health authorities.

title: WATCH : ATACMS Destroys Russian S - 300 Anti - Missile System Near Occupied Mariupol
message:
Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces (AFU), Oleksandr Syrsky, announced a successful strike on a Russian S-300 anti-missile system near Mariupol in the occupied Donetsk region.
Syrsky confirmed the strike and commended Ukrainian servicemen for their successful execution of the mission.
On July 16, Syrsky released a video confirming the destruction of the Russian S-300 system.
According to Militarnyi media outlet, Ukrainian missile forces used ATACMS to fire at least four M39 cluster ballistic missiles at Russian anti-aircraft positions on the outskirts of Mariupol.
The Russian S-300’s location was pinpointed east of Mangush village in the Donetsk region, approximately 7 kilometers from the Mariupol airfield, as reported by Militarnyi.
event_breakdown: AFU successfully destroyed Russian S-300 anti-missile system near Mariupol, Donetsk region.

title: Nasrallah Threatens to Attack Additional Parts of Israel | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | Jewish News Syndicate ( JNS ) | 12 Tammuz 5784 – Thursday , July 18 , 2024
message:
Photo Credit: Tasnim News AgencyHiding in his underground bunker, Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah threatened to attack Israeli communities that have not come under fire yet if the IDF continues to, in his words, “attack civilians” in Southern Lebanon.
He made the statement after noting an alleged increase in the number of “non-involved” casualties in Lebanon in recent days.
“Israel is not only short on soldiers to fight the war, now it is suffering from a shortage of tanks and munitions,” the terrorist leader said.
He called on “Palestinians” around the world to join in supporting the war against Israel.
“We also call on the Palestinian people to unite today among the resistance shaping the fate of Palestine, the region, and the people,” Nasrallah said.
event_breakdown:
Since the Israeli missile strike that killed prominent Iranian Revolutionary Guard member and Hezbollah militant, a new Israeli military campaign against Hezbollah in Lebanon has led to another attack along the Israel-Lebanon border that left two Hezbollah members dead. The border clash began when the Israeli military began firing flares and smoke bombs to disperse Hezbollah border protesters who were gathering in attempt to distract Israeli soldiers from work to be done by the excavators hired by Hezbollah, which were busy digging underground tunnels into Israeli territory.

The Israeli Defense Force confirmed it fired artillery shells at the area. Hezbollah also fired an anti-tank missile from Lebanon towards an area near the Lebanese border in what an IDF spokesman said was a "terrorist attack".

Hezbollah's leader, Nasrallah, has warned Israel they could have "no safe place" for a week after the missile strike that killed his comrade, who was a member of the elite Quds force.

"I say to the Israeli army on the border from tonight, stand back, and stand down because if you cross the border, it is Lebanon that will dictate the rules," Nasrallah said.

"The rules have changed," Nasrallah added.

In response to the mounting tensions, the Israeli military spokesman told reporters that Israel had attacked what it termed "infrastructure at the border that is used to transport forces and weapons intended for an attack on Israeli territory".

This is the 5th border skirmish between the shadowy groups of Hezbollah in the last 6 days.

event_breakdown:
A.D. 1991 - DIY OS:

In 1991, a group of software developers met at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign to discuss the creation of a new operating system. Their goal was to design a system that would be easy to use and would allow users to create and modify their own software.

After several years of development, the group released the first version of the DIY OS in 1993. Since then, the DIY OS has been used by millions of people around the world to create their own software.

The DIY OS is open-source software, which means that it is free to download and use. It is also highly customizable, allowing users to add new features and remove existing ones. This makes it a popular choice for software developers and technical enthusiasts.
While the DIY OS was initially designed for personal computers, it has since been ported to a wide range of devices, including smartphones, tablets, and even video game consoles. The DIY OS is also used in a variety of industrial applications, such as robotics and automation.

Overall, the DIY OS has had a significant impact on the software industry. It has helped to democratize software development and empower users to create their own software.

title: Israel Pounds Central Gaza , Sends Tanks Into North of Rafah
message:
Israeli forces pounded areas in the central Gaza Strip on Wednesday, killing at least nine Palestinians, according to health officials, while Israeli tanks carried out a limited advance further into Rafah in the south.
Israeli tanks also shelled the eastern areas of Al-Bureij and Al-Maghazi camps in the center of enclave, residents said.
Medics said an Israeli strike killed two people in Rafah on Wednesday, while residents said the forces had blown up dozens of homes.
The Israeli military said troops were "continuing precise, intelligence-based operational activity in the Rafah area."
Many of the hundreds of Palestinians Israel has released in the past months have accused Israeli forces of ill-treatment and torture.

title: Only a matter of time  before an assassination attempt is made on an Australian politician , warns Karen Andrews
message:
Former home affairs minister Karen Andrews has backed a review into protective security arrangements as she claimed it was “only a matter of time” before an assassination attempt was made on an Australian politician.
Ms Andrews had warned of an attempt on the life of an Australian politician in the wake of former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe's assassination in July 2022.
She doubled down on her stance on Tuesday telling The Australian she was “concerned” a similar assassination attempt would be made in Australia, following the attempted shooting of Donald Trump at a campaign rally over the weekend.
Former home affairs minister Karen Andrews has warned it is “only a matter of time” before an assassination attempt is made on an Australian politician.
Ms Andrews, who served as home affairs minister from March 2021 through May 2022, said it was "only a matter of time" before a similar attempt on a politician's life was made in Australia.

title: Good Samaritan helps stabbing victim south of Downtown
message:
(COLORADO SPRINGS) — A good Samaritan helped transport an injured victim of a possible stabbing on Tuesday morning, July 16.
According to the Colorado Springs Police Department (CSPD), officers were originally notified by members of the Colorado Springs Fire Department (CSFD) about a possible shooting at a gas station in the 1000 block of South Nevada Avenue, south of Downtown Colorado Springs.
CSPD said a good Samaritan found an adult man suffering from some kind of injury near Fountain Boulevard and Chelton Road and was transporting him to a hospital when the individual spotted CSFD and stopped for medical attention.
CSPD said the victim was “in an altered mental state” and was not providing much factual information.
He was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, which were determined to be caused by a possible stabbing, not a gunshot.

title: How would killing Mohammad Deif affect Israel - Hamas War ?
message:
Some might think of Yahya Sinwar, the current leader of Hamas in Gaza, who is living hiding in tunnels, but fewer people know of Hamas’s military chief, Mohammad Deif.
Israel recently targeted Deif in an IDF airstrike in a humanitarian zone near Khan Yunis in southern Gaza.
He emerged from the tunnels in the Khan Yunis refugee camp to meet with Ra’fat Salama, the commander of Khan Yunis, Al-Mawasi.
According to Saudi sources, there was a breach in Deif’s security circle, and someone provided information on his movements to Israel.
It is believed that Deif was meeting Al-Mawasi over the negotiations of a hostage deal or to issue orders for Hamas’ activities in Khan Yunis.

title: Richmond : Person of interest in Fourth of July stabbing dead
message:
RICHMOND — A man suspected in the fatal Fourth of July stabbing of a woman has been found dead in Mexico, while another person that police sought in the shooting death of a man near the Richmond Parkway has been arrested in Nebraska, authorities said.
Edirlei Tofolio was a person of interest in the July 4 stabbing death of 48-year-old Elindenia Silva, of El Sobrante.
Richmond police spokesperson Lt. Donald Patchin said he was found dead in Mexico on July 9.
In the other incident, police arrested Arcenio Marquez late last month following the shooting death of Elizander Narvaez-Fernandez, 26, of Richmond on June 23, Patchin said.
Police in Richmond have investigated nine homicides in 2024, one more than in all of 2023.

title: Hezbollah threatens to target new Israeli sites if civilians are killed
message:
BEIRUT, July 17 — Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah warned Wednesday that his Iran-backed group would hit new targets in Israel if more civilians are killed in Israeli strikes on Lebanon.
“If the enemy continues to target civilians as it has done in recent days, then this will push us to target localities that we have not targeted until now,” Nasrallah said.
Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency said Israeli strikes in the south killed five people, including three Syrian children, on Tuesday.
Nasrallah warned Israel of the consequences of any invasion of Lebanon, saying Israel would be left without any tanks if a full-blown conflict erupted.
On the Israeli side, 17 soldiers and 13 civilians have been killed, according to authorities.

title: Suspect arrested in Tri - Valley BART stabbing
message:
PLEASANTON — A woman passenger on a BART train was stabbed Wednesday morning and a suspect was later arrested, officials said.
BART officials said the woman was injured by a “sharpened object” but did not specify what the weapon was.
The man suspected in the attack fled the train but was arrested by BART police outside the station moments later, BART spokesman Chris Filippi said.
Authorities did not release a motive for the attack and said at this point in the investigation it does not appear the suspect knew the woman.
BART service was shut down between the Dublin/Pleasanton and West Dublin/Pleasanton stations for about an hour while police investigated.
event_breakdown: BART service was shut down between the Dublin/Pleasanton and West Dublin/Pleasanton stations for about an hour while police were called to investigate a stabbing that occurred on the train Wednesday morning. A man was arrested outside the station moments after the attack, which was allegedly committed by another man with a sharpened object. The woman was attacked in the Dublin/Pleasanton station, and there were no further details about a motive or a planned attack, officials said. The BART spokesman did not release a map of the incident, but said it was an isolated incident.

Israel-Hamas Conflict

The current hostilities between Israel and Hamas have been ongoing since May 2021. The conflict has resulted in the deaths of hundreds of people, the displacement of thousands more, and widespread destruction in the Gaza Strip. Diplomatic efforts by Arab mediators, backed by the United States, have been ongoing to try to bring an end to the hostilities, but have so far been unsuccessful. Israel and Hamas have both expressed a willingness to continue talks, but the back-and-forth blame game between the two sides has hindered progress in finding a resolution to the conflict.

title: Oil spill feared in Red Sea as Houthis attack tanker - Newspaper
message:
CAIRO: Liberia-flagged oil tanker Chios Lion was assessing damage and investigating a potential oil spill after it was attacked by Yemeni Houthis in the Red Sea, the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden Joint Maritime Information Center (JMIC) said on Tuesday.
“While originally headed south, following the attack the vessel turned around and back north out of the threat area to further assess the damage and investigate potential oil spillage,” the JMIC said in a statement.
The manager of Chios Lion did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
The Houthis said they targeted Chios Lion and Bentley I with ballistic missiles, drones and booby-trapped boats in response to the deadly Israeli airstrike on the southern Gaza Strip city of Khan Younis on Saturday.
They also pose a risk to the environment in the form of spilt cargo such as oil and fertiliser, as well as fuel used to power vessels.
event_breakdown: Yemen's Houthi militia said they attacked an oil tanker and a cargo ship in the Red Sea on Tuesday in response to a weekend airstrike by the Saudi-led coalition on a Yemen prison that killed more than 160 people.

title: Relatives of those killed when MH17 was shot down mark 10 years since tragedy that claimed 298 lives
message:
Vijfhuizen (Netherlands), Jul 17 (AP) Relatives of passengers and crew killed when Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 was shot down over Ukraine gathered on Wednesday to mark the 10th anniversary of the tragedy that claimed 298 lives, over half of whom were Dutch.
Families of the victims blamed Russian-backed rebels for the missile that took down the plane, but Moscow has repeatedly denied responsibility.
Commemoration services took place in the Netherlands, Australia and the site of the crash in the Russia-controlled part of the Donetsk region, as the war in Ukraine raged on.
“Today we remain unwavering in our determination to ensure truth, justice and accountability for the victims and their loved ones,” Dreyfus said.
An international investigation initiated in the U.N. Security Council by the Netherlands, Malaysia and Australia concluded that the Buk missile system that destroyed MH17 belonged to the Russian 53rd Anti-Aircraft Missile Brigade.

Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 shot down over Ukraine

title: North Korean nuclear weapons , 2024
message:
North Korean nuclear weapons, 2024Bulletin By Hans M. Kristensen, Matt Korda, Eliana Johns, Mackenzie Knight | July 15, 2024North Korea continues to modernize and grow its nuclear weapons arsenal.
North Korea’s nuclear policyFor decades, North Korea has made numerous statements and signals about its nuclear weapons policy, laying out its nuclear doctrine if deterrence fails.
In 2013, for example, North Korea’s “Law on Consolidating the Position of Nuclear Weapons State” suggested a no-first-use policy, noting that North Korea’s nuclear arsenal would only be used “to repel invasion or attack from a hostile nuclear weapons state and make retaliatory strikes” (KCNA 2013).
Such caveats culminated in September 2022 when North Korea’s parliament codified in law North Korea’s right to launch nuclear weapons preemptively (Kim 2022).
North Korea’s nuclear weapons programPlutonium production operationsThe Yongbyon Nuclear Scientific Research Center, located in North Pyongan province, has been called the “beating heart” of North Korea’s nuclear weapons program.

title: Ukraine trauma continues ; UN , NATO scramble for solution
message:
By John J. MetzlerAs Ukraine’s war enters its third summer of fighting, there’s a morbid cadence to the conflict.
Following the unprovoked attack on the hospital, which was for specialized cancer patients, the 15-member U.N. Security Council met in an emergency session.
There was a sullen stillness to the Security Council meeting on the Kyiv attacks.
Kyslytsya stressed that the Russian “war criminals will wind up in hell, bypassing purgatory.”As expected no resolution nor formal statement was voted on, just this verbal rebuke.
Two hundred miles to the south in Washington, NATO was commemorating the 75th anniversary of the Atlantic Alliance in 1949.
event_breakdown:
On April 7, 2022 the United Nations Security Council met in an emergency session to discuss the targeted Russian bombing of a children’s hospital and cancer center in Kyiv. Ukrainian ambassador Kyslytsya lashed out at the Russian Federation calling the consequences of the bombing are intentional attacks on the civilian population and a war crime.
Offered the us diplomatic response to this emergency United Nations meeting at security Council
The U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations condemned the attack on the children’s hospital and cancer center, calling it “barbaric” and an “atrocity.”
The Ambassador also announced that the U.S. will provide an additional $500 million in humanitarian assistance to Ukraine to assist in the country’s war effort.

title: Egyptian , French leaders discuss efforts to reach ceasefire in Gaza
message:
视频播放位置 下载安装Flash播放器People stand among the rubble after an Israeli airstrike in Al-Maghazi refugee camp, central Gaza Strip, on July 15, 2024.
[Photo/Xinhua]Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi held a phone talk with his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday to discuss efforts to reach a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip, the Egyptian presidency said in a statement.
During the call, Sissi briefed Macron on Egypt's mediation efforts between Israel and Hamas, while highlighting the need for uniting international efforts to ensure the success of mediation and deliver adequate humanitarian aid into the besieged Palestinian enclave.
Macron expressed appreciation for Egypt's persistent efforts since the onset of the ongoing Israel-Palestine crisis.
The two leaders reiterated the need to advance the two-state solution as the best way to achieve lasting security and stability in the region, according to the statement.

title: Ludlow Massacre site receives restoration grant from National Park Service
message:
The National Park Service is providing more than $150,000 towards preserving the site of the 1914 Ludlow Massacre.
The grant was announced last week as part of the American Battlefield Protection Program.
The Colorado National Guard attack on mine workers north of Trinidad is considered a turning point in the history of the U.S. Labor movement.
In response, on April 20th, National Guard troops aligned with the Colorado Fuel and Iron Company attacked the approximately 1,200-member colony in an attempt to break the strike.
The grant funds announced last week go to the United Mine Workers of America, who will oversee the preservation and interpretation of the site, which became a National Historic Landmark in 2009.

title: How Militia Groups Capture States And Ruin Countries : The Case Of Sudan Rapid Support Forces
message:
Sudan's central created the Rapid Support Forces in 2013 as dictator Omar al-Bashir's private protection detail.
Growing influenceThe Rapid Support Forces emerged from the Janjaweed militias , which spearheaded al-Bashir's genocidal counterinsurgency in Darfur in exchange for funding and arms.
In 2013, al-Bashir restructured the Janjaweed into the Rapid Support Forces to counterbalance the army and preempt potential coups.
Capitalising on this positioning, the Rapid Support Forces expanded its involvement in gold mining, smuggling and trading.
Concerned by these developments, the Sudanese Armed Forces attempted to forcefully integrate the Rapid Support Forces into the military chain of command.

title: Expanded China - Cuba military cooperation threatens sensitive U . S . southern bases
message:
FPI / July 14, 2024Geostrategy-DirectBy Richard FisherIn 2024 the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) is demonstrating increasing boldness in its capacity to execute aggression and to position itself for warfare with the United States.
Cuba-China military cooperation is longstanding, having become active during the 1990s as the former Soviet Union could not afford the upkeep for its electronic (ELINT) and signals intelligence (SIGINT) bases built up during the 1960s following the aborted Soviet deployment of nuclear missiles following the October 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.
China could have become a significant supplier of weapons to the Cuban Communist regime, now one of the few Communist states, hugely valued by the CCP as fellow Commiunist comrade, but it chose to stress intelligence cooperation, most likely to avoid triggering an extreme U.S. reaction.
That may now be changing, and China could be on a path to significantly expanding its military cooperation with Cuba, starting with building up its intelligence gathering and monitoring facilities.
Subscription InformationFree Press International

title: Myanmar junta opponents launch rocket attack on capital airport
message:
YANGON: Opponents of Myanmar’s junta launched a rocket attack on an airport in the capital Naypyidaw but caused no casualties, security sources said on Wednesday (July 17), after a rare breach of the military’s seat of power.
Two rockets targeted Naypyidaw Airport on the morning of July 16, a security source told Agence France-Presse (AFP), on condition of anonymity.
Two other security sources said one rocket was launched at the airport.
In April, PDF groups launched more than a dozen drones at targets in Naypyidaw, temporarily closing the airport.
Outgunned and outnumbered, opponents of the junta have increasingly taken drones into their arsenal, with devastating effect.

The military council in the town had raised red-coded alarm following the attack, presuming an imminent opponent assault on other military rulers’ installations.

title: Lebanon War With Israel Will Not Stop As Long As Offensive Against Gaza Continues : Hezbollah Leader
message:
(MENAFN- Nam News Network) BEIRUT, Jul 18 (NNN-NNA) – Hezbollah leader, Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, said yesterday that, Lebanon's war with Israel will not stop, as long as the offensive against Gaza continues.
In a televised speech, marking the Islamic holy day of Ashura, Nasrallah warned Israel against“going too far” in targeting civilians in southern Lebanon, saying, it will push its group“to launch missiles and target new settlements that were not previously targeted.”He denied rumours about an agreement to be reached regarding the Lebanese front, stressing that“the future of the situation in the south, will be decided in light of the results of the battle” in Gaza.
“If the war stops, the party responsible for negotiating is the Lebanese state,” said Nasrallah.
In addition, Nasrallah accused America of“bearing full responsibility” for the killing of Palestinian civilians by the Israeli Zionist army, because it supplied weapons to them.
Nasrallah also vowed to rebuild villages and towns, destroyed by the Zionist army, in the confrontations.– NNN-NNA

title: US imposes visa restrictions on former IDF sergeant for human rights violation
message:
CNN —The Biden administration imposed visa restrictions on former Israel Defense Forces (IDF) sergeant Elor Azaria “for his involvement in a gross violation of human rights, namely an extrajudicial killing in the West Bank,” State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller announced Wednesday.
The State Department is “also taking steps to impose visa restrictions on an additional group of individuals for having been involved in or meaningfully contributed to undermining the peace, security, or stability in the West Bank,” Miller said in a statement.
“There hasn’t been appropriate accountability across the board” in response to the violence against Palestinians in the West Bank, Miller said at a press briefing Wednesday.
A Palestinian, Abdel Fattah al-Sharif, 21, was one of two men accused of stabbing another Israeli soldier in the West Bank city of Hebron in March.
At the State Department briefing Wednesday, Miller explained that the US is required to impose visa restrictions on officials found to have committed gross violations of human rights.
event_breakdown: IDF Sergeant Elor Azaria was found guilty of manslaughter in the March 2016 shooting of Abdel Fattah al-Sharif, a Palestinian assailant who had stabbed another soldier in the West Bank city of Hebron.

Houthi rebels in Yemen have claimed responsibility for attacking a crude oil tanker in lower Red Sea region. The tanker was identified as Chios Lion (IMO 9398280) and was heading North of Yemen when it was attacked on Nov. 6.

The second ship, recognized as the 176-meter Bentley I (IMO 9253129) has spoted in danger of a possible attack in the same area as Chios Lion on Nov. 6.

title: Explosions Rocked Crimea Last Night
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Explosions were heard overnight near Myrne and Novoozerne, as well as in the area of the Kozacha Bay in Sevastopol in temporarily occupied Crimea.
"Crimean Telegram channels reported on explosions in the area of Myrne and Novoozerne, as well as near the Kozacha Bay in Sevastopol," the post reads.
Subscribers to the Telegram Crimean Wind reported that explosions were heard and the lights went out in Novoozerne last night.
There were also reports of explosions and shooting in the area of the Kozacha Bay in temporarily occupied Sevastopol.
Russia's Defense Ministry reported on an apparently massive drone attack on temporarily occupied Crimea and that 33 drones and several unmanned surface vehicles had allegedly been destroyed and intercepted over the peninsula.
event_breakdown: Explosions heard near Myrne and Novoozerne, as well as in the area of the Kozacha Bay in Sevastopol.

title: Man Injured In Car Explosion In The Shomron In Suspected Terror Attack
message:
An Israeli man was injured by an explosive device that detonated as he got out of his vehicle in the Chermash area of northern Shomron late Thursday afternoon.
The victim was treated by emergency medical forces and was evacuated to Hillel Yaffe Hospital in Hadera in light condition.
There were two other people in the car but Baruch Hashem, they weren’t injured.
IDF forces are at the scene.
(YWN Israel Desk – Jerusalem)

event_breakdown:
KHARKIV, Ukraine -- After a Russian missile strike on May 11, one of Ukraine's largest book-printing plants looked like a massacre. Windows and doors were blown open, books were scattered by the blast, thousands of manuscripts were destroyed.

The night before, workers at the printing plant called Vivat, in northeastern Ukraine, had hit the Russians back by deleting data from a server housing the Russian translation of a book about pro-Russian separatists written by a local Ukrainian author. According to publisher Volodymyr Monastyrskyi, the move infuriated Russian forces and was apparently why they aimed a missile at Vivat -- which it missed, because it aimed short of its target. The missile hit a neighboring textile factory, which was renovated eight years later, Monastyrskyi said, with Russian translation.

“I got shelled,” he said. “How is that even possible?”

Kharkiv, where Vivat is located, has been bombed more than any other city in Ukraine since the Russian invasion began on February 24. But if anything, people are more cheerful than ever, said Monastyrskyi, even though lots -- perhaps thousands -- of Ukraine’s writers are dead and others are fighting on the front line while Ukraine is fighting the world’s fourth-biggest army.

title: IDF soldier injured while securing humanitarian aid in Gaza
message:
Hamas terrorists on Wednesday fired an RPG missile at IDF troops who were stationed along the humanitarian route, while humanitarian aid trucks were driving along the route.
As a result of the attack, an IDF soldier was moderately injured.
Following the attack, the humanitarian route was temporarily closed.
A few hours later, coordination and distribution of aid on the humanitarian route resumed.
"The IDF, via COGAT, will continue to operate in accordance with international law in order to allow and facilitate humanitarian aid for civilians in the Gaza Strip," the IDF stressed.
event_breakdown: IDF troops targeted by RPG attack near southern Gaza border

title: What Thomas Matthew Crooks did in hours leading up to attack on Trump
message:
The 20-year-old purchased ammunition shortly before the incident, both online and in-person, according to law enforcement sources.
For at least an hour before the shooting, Crooks was seen walking around near the rally area.
He was also seen walking around near the magnetometers minutes before the shooting, according to law enforcement sources.
Some witnesses reported him as a suspicious person, law enforcement sources said.
A Secret Service sniper shot back at Crooks, fatally shooting him in the head 26 seconds later, according to law enforcement officials.
location: The main location where the event takes place is the United States

Security: Suspected Shooter Shot Dead by Secret Service
Date: June 9, 2022
Location: Washington, D.C.

A 20-year-old man, Noah Crooks, was shot dead by a Secret Service sniper on June 9, 2022, at a campaign rally in Washington, D.C. Crooks is suspected of shooting three individuals at the rally, including a U.S. Park Police officer who was transported to the hospital in good spirits. The Secret Service and Capitol Police are conducting a joint investigation into the shooting.

title: Ukraine Says Still Fighting on Dnipro River Left Bank
message:
Ukraine said Thursday its defensive positions around the village of Krynky on the left bank of the Dnipro river in the southern Kherson region had been destroyed but that it was continuing operations there.
"Ukraine's defence forces are continuing to carry out combat missions on the left bank of the Dnipro river, including in the Krynky area," military spokesman Dmytro Lykhoviy said on state television.
"Besides Krynky, we have other bridgeheads, and combat work on the left bank of the Dnipro river is continuing."
